title: Who uses the Typophile iCal calendar?
content:
I like the Typophile iCal calendar, but I noticed it's missing some important birthdays. How do we add information? I'm new to the whole iCal concept, having previously kept all my appointments written in sharpie on my hand and/or other appendages.

 [‹ Impact: history/origins?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121142923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6577 "Go to previous forum topic") [Taking a moral stance on Squooshed ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121142923/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6471 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jlt

comments.content:
I fell in love with iCal in Mid-July, and am use the Typeoff tool.   
   
My birthday is not on it, though ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121142923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
As I recall, the b-days on the iCal were added because of a thread called something like 'When's your birthday?' (makes sense, doesn't it?) Someone then took the time to syncronize the iCal .

I have the Typophile iCal calendar loaded on my Mac, and find immensely informative. Of course, my birthday has been included (as per the aforementioned thread), so perhaps I'm biased. This tool definitely needs to be pimped more regularly. Pity the poor souls relegated to that 'Windoze' platform...
Well my birthday is August 3 just in case anyone is interested... ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121142923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Well, freakin Happy belated B-Day Josh!
